info.title: Withings developer documentation
info.description:
# Models Some services require specific model parameters. The following sections detail parameters formats. Only refer to those sections if an API service parameter description specifies it. ## Unit preferences Optionally, partner can specify end-user unit preferences. The ```unit_pref``` parameter must be composed of a ```JSON``` object with the following parameter: | Name | Type | |----------------|--------------| | weight | integer | | height | integer | | distance | integer | | temperature | integer | The following tables present integer values of unit preferences: | Weight unit | Value | |----------------|--------------| | kilogram (kg) | 1 | | pound (lb) | 2 | | Imperial stone:pound (StLb) | 14 | | Height unit | Value | |----------------|--------------| | meter (m) | 6 | | inch (in) | 7 | | Distance unit | Value | |----------------|--------------| | kilometer (km) | 6 | | yard (yd) | 8 | | Temperature unit | Value | |----------------|--------------| | degree Celsius (°C) | 11 | | Fahrenheit (°F) | 13 | Example of unit preference parameter: ```json {"weight":1,"height":7,"distance":8,"temperature":13} ``` **Important**: please note that even if weight and height unit preferences are not in kilograms or meters, the measure values of [Measures](#section/Models/Measures) model must be set in kilograms and meters. ## Measures The following table presents the required measure data that is contained in the user data ```measures``` parameter. The ```measures``` parameter must be composed of two mandatory ```JSON``` objects, one for the weight measurement and another with the height measurement, both with the following parameter: | Name | Type | Required | Comments | |----------------|--------------|---------------|-----------------------------------------------------------| | value | integer | yes | Height or weight value as integer not float. Ex: 187 or 6000| | unit | integer | yes | Decimal exponent to get the parameter ```value``` in meters and kilos. Ex: value=187. unit=-2. Height=1,87m| | type | integer | yes | Possible values are: Height = ```4```. Weight = ```1```.| **Important**: please note that weight value must be in kilograms and height value in meters. The weight must be between 1 and 600kg and the height between 0.1 and 3m. Example of ```JSON``` object to be used as plain text parameter: ```json { "preflang": "en_EN", "birthdate": "12345678", "gender": 1, "shortname": "ABC", "measures": [ { "value": 180, "unit": -2, "type": 4 }, { "value": 8000, "unit": -2, "type": 1 } ], ... } ``` ## Order The following table presents the required order data that is contained in the dropshipment service ```order``` parameter. The ```order``` parameter is a list of ```JSON``` objects that constitute product purchase orders, each product purchase order having the following parameter: ### 1. Order | Name | Type | Required | Comments | |------------------|--------------|---------------|-----------------------------------------------------------| | customer_ref_id | string | yes | Random identifier you must provide. It will be used to track your order and **must be unique**.| | address | json | yes | Order delivery information. Refer to below **ADDRESS** table.| | products | integer | yes | Ordered products. Refer to below **PRODUCTS** table.| | force_address | boolean | no | If set to ```true```, the address will not be verified. (default is ```false```) If the address is not validated by carrier, Withings Logistics will ignore the address error and try to ship to the provided address anyway.| ### 2. Address | Name | Type | Required | Comments | |-------------|--------------|---------------|-----------------------------------------------------------| | name | string | yes | Client's fullname.| | company_name | string | no | Company name.| | email | string | yes | Client's email.| | telephone | string | no | Client's phone number in E.164 format.| | address1 | string | yes | Client's primary address (Street address with number).| | address2 | string | no | Client's additional address (Apartment or suite number).| | city | string | yes | Client's city address.| | zip | string | yes | Client's zipcode address.| | state | string | no | Client's state address in ISO2 format.| | country | string | yes | Client's country address in ISO2 format.| ### 3. Products | Name | Type | Required | Comments | |----------------|--------------|---------------|-----------------------------------------------------------| | ean | string | yes | Product international article number.| | quantity | int | yes | Product quantity.| ### 4. Example Example of ```JSON``` object to be used as plain text parameter: ```json [ { "address": { "name": "John Wayne", "email": "john.wayne@farwest.com", "address1": "1st Avenue", "address2": "Apartment 12", "city": "New-York", "zip": "10001", "state": "NY", "country": "US" }, "customer_ref_id": "IMAGINARY_CUSTOMER_REF_1", "products": [ { "quantity": 1, "ean": "WI220002EAN" }, { "quantity": 3, "ean": "WI330002EAN" } ] }, { "address": { "name": "Calamity Jane", "email": "calamity.jane@farwest.com", "address1": "SW 8th St", "address2": "Block 1", "city": "Miami", "zip": "33135", "state": "FL", "country": "US" }, "customer_ref_id": "IMAGINARY_CUSTOMER_REF_2", "products": [ { "quantity": 2, "ean": "WI220002EAN" }, { "quantity": 1, "ean": "WI440002EAN" }, { "quantity": 1, "ean": "WI550002EAN" } ] } ] ``` ## Goals Optionally, partner can specify end-user goals. The ```goals``` parameter must be composed of a ```JSON``` object with the following parameter: | Name | Type | Comments | |----------------|--------------|-------------------------------------| | steps | integer | Number of steps per day | | sleep | integer | Sleep duration (in seconds) | | weight | json | Weight. Refer to below **WEIGHT** table | ### Weight | Name | Type | Comments | |----------------|--------------|----------| | value | integer | Weight value as integer, in kilograms | | unit | integer | Decimal exponent to get the parameter ```value``` in kilos. Ex: value=8000. unit=-2. Weight=80kg | Example of goals parameter: ```json { "steps": 10000, "sleep": 28800, "weight": { "value": 70500, "unit": -3 } } ``` # Response status For security reasons Withings cannot share with partners the exact nature of the API error status they may receive. Instead, we share families of errors, and some webservices will also return a detailled message about the nature of the error. For instance, an invalid param status code might be coupled with a detail message stating which params caused the error. If you are facing one of the following family of errors, here's what you should do : - **Authentication failed**: Check if your tokens are correct and properly set. - **Invalid params**: Check your tokens and your params. - **Not Implemented**: The service does not exist. - **Unauthorized**: You are not allowed to call this service. - **An error occurred**: Check your tokens and your params. If the error persists please contact us. If you still can't find what's causing the issue, please contact our support team for assistance.

# Glossary Find out more information about this documentation vocabulary in our [Glossary](https://developer.withings.com/developer-guide/glossary/glossary)

tags.name: dropshipment
tags.description:
The following services are part of the Logistics APIs. Refer to [this section](/developer-guide/v3/integration-guide/dropship-only/logistics-api/overview-create-order) for more information.

The Logistics APIs allows partners to dropship devices directly to their program members.

**Important**: To receive automatic notification on order status, please fill a dropshipment notify URI for your API application in your [Developer Dashboard](https://developer.withings.com/dashboard/).

tags.name: order
tags.description: The following services are part of the Logistics APIs. Refer to [this section](/developer-guide/v3/integration-guide/dropship-only/logistics-api/overview-create-order) for more information.

tags.name: measure
tags.description: The following services gives access to several types of Health Data collected by a user. The data are only available once a synchronization occured between the device and Withings servers (which might include synchronizing with Withings mobile application or via Withings Mobile SDK).

tags.name: heart
tags.description:
Returns ECG (EKG) signal points in micro-volt (μV). 

You can use the [Heart - List](#operation/heartv2-list) service to get the list of ECG records and their corresponding ```signalid``` and then use [Heart - Get](#operation/heartv2-get) to get the signal details.
		
The data are only available once a synchronization occured between the device and Withings servers (which might include synchronizing with Withings mobile application or via Withings Mobile SDK).

tags.name: sleep
tags.description:
Returns data related to user sleep activities, wether they are captured by an Activity Tracker or a Sleep Monitor.
		
The data are only available once a synchronization occured between the device and Withings servers (which might include synchronizing with Withings mobile application or via Withings Mobile SDK).

tags.name: notify
tags.description:
These services will allow you to be notified when new data is collected by Withings devices, or when specific events happen.
		Learn more about our notification services in [the dedicated section](/developer-guide/v3/data-api/keep-user-data-up-to-date/)

tags.name: signature
tags.description: The following services are part of the Logistics APIs. Refer to [this section](/developer-guide/v3/integration-guide/dropship-only/logistics-api/overview-create-order) for more information.

tags.name: rawdata
tags.description: Raw Data webservices are part of the Advanced research API that allows to collect high frequency PPG and accelerometer data (around 25Hz). These APIs are compatible only with the Withings ScanWatch. If you need more information about how to use these APIs and how to parse the data, please have a look the [dedicated integration guide](/developer-guide/v3/integration-guide/advanced-research-api/advanced-research-api-overview).

tags.name: measure
tags.description: The following services gives access to several types of Health Data collected by a user. The data are only available once a synchronization occured between the device and Withings servers (which might include synchronizing with Withings mobile application or via Withings Mobile SDK).

get.description:
Use the ```authorize``` method which will construct a URL and redirect to it. It will ask the user for permissions. The user will be able to sign up for a new account or to sign in with their existing account.

When the user has accepted, he is redirected to your application (using the redirect_uri) with the authorization code and the state passed as URL parameters.

**Important**:

 - Must be called as GET call.
 - The authorization code is valid for 30 seconds.

parameters.name: response_type
parameters.description: Must take the constant string value ```code```.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: Your ```Client ID```.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: A value you define. This can be used to make sure that the redirect back to your site or app wasn’t spoofed.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of permission scopes you want to ask your user for (see the [Index Data API](/developer-guide/v3/data-api/all-available-health-data) section to know which scope you should use).

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description:
The URI we should redirect the user to after choosing to authorize or not your app. This URI must be set as ```Callback Url``` in your partner application. It is possible to use multiple URLs by separating them with a comma.
Examples:
  • Callbacks: https://mydomain.com/
  • Callback: https://mydomain.com/,https://mydomain2.com/
  • Valid URL: https://mydomain.com/relative_path?args=value

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Only set to use the demo user. For demo user must take the constant string value ```demo```.

post.description:
After you obtain the authorization code you can request an ```access_token```.

**Important:** Must be called as POST call and parameters must be set in the body request as application/x-www-form-urlencoded parameters and not in the url.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Must take the string value ```requesttoken```.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: Your ```Client ID```.

parameters.name: nonce
parameters.description: DO NOT USE WITH FOLLOWING PARAMS: [client_secret]. A random token used to prevent replay attacks (Cf. [Signature v2 - Getnonce](#operation/signaturev2-getnonce)).

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description: DO NOT USE WITH FOLLOWING PARAMS: [client_secret]. Hash of params (Cf. [Signature hash protocol](/developer-guide/v3/get-access/sign-your-requests)).

parameters.name: client_secret
parameters.description: DO NOT USE WITH FOLLOWING PARAMS: [signature,nonce]. Your ```Client Secret```.

parameters.name: grant_type
parameters.description: Must take the constant string value ```authorization_code```.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The Authorization Code you got from previous step.

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: The URI you use in the first call.

status.description: Response status. See Status section for details.

expires_in.description: Access token expiry delay in seconds.

scope.description: You can get only the scope that the user accepted with the Token you have. Scopes can be 'user.info' 'user.metrics' 'user.activity' 'user.sleepevents'  and must be separated by a coma.

x-codeSamples.source:
<?php

$ch = curl_init();

curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, "/v2/oauth2");

curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, TRUE);

curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query([ 
	'action' => 'requesttoken',
	'grant_type' => 'authorization_code',
	'client_id' => '7573fd4a4c421ddd102dac406dc6e0e0e22f683c4a5e81ff0a5caf8b65abed67',
	'client_secret' => 'd9286311451fc6ed71b372a075c58c5058be158f56a77865e43ab3783255424f',
	'code' => 'mtwsikawoqleuroqcluggflrqilrnqbgqvqeuhhh',
	'redirect_uri' => 'https://www.withings.com'
]));

$rsp = curl_exec($ch);
curl_close($ch);

var_dump($rsp);

?>

curl --data "action=requesttoken&grant_type=authorization_code&client_id=7573fd4a4c421ddd102dac406dc6e0e0e22f683c4a5e81ff0a5caf8b65abed67&client_secret=d9286311451fc6ed71b372a075c58c5058be158f56a77865e43ab3783255424f&code=mtwsikawoqleuroqcluggflrqilrnqbgqvqeuhhh&redirect_uri=https://www.withings.com" 'https://wbsapi.withings.net/v2/oauth2'

post.description:
If user's ```access_token``` is expired, use this service with user's ```refresh_token``` to get a new ```access_token``` (and a new ```refresh_token```) and be able to make requests again.

**Important:**

 - Must be called as POST call and parameters must be set in the body request as application/x-www-form-urlencoded parameters and not in the url.
 - This service also returns a new  ```refresh_token```. You have to overwrite your current  ```refresh_token``` with the new one.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Must take the string value ```requesttoken```.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: Your ```Client ID```.

parameters.name: nonce
parameters.description: DO NOT USE WITH FOLLOWING PARAMS: [client_secret]. A random token used to prevent replay attacks (Cf. [Signature v2 - Getnonce](#operation/signaturev2-getnonce)).

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description: DO NOT USE WITH FOLLOWING PARAMS: [client_secret]. Hash of params (Cf. [Signature hash protocol](/developer-guide/v3/get-access/sign-your-requests)).

parameters.name: client_secret
parameters.description: DO NOT USE WITH FOLLOWING PARAMS: [signature,nonce]. Your ```Client Secret```.

parameters.name: grant_type
parameters.description: Must take the constant string value ```refresh_token```.

parameters.name: refresh_token
parameters.description: The current valid ```refresh_token```.

status.description: Response status. See Status section for details.

expires_in.description: Access token expiry delay in seconds.

scope.description: You can get only the scope that the user accepted with the Token you have. Scopes can be 'user.info' 'user.metrics' 'user.activity' 'user.sleepevents'  and must be separated by a coma.

x-codeSamples.source:
<?php

$ch = curl_init();

curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, "/v2/oauth2");

curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, TRUE);

curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query([ 
	'action' => 'requesttoken',
	'grant_type' => 'refresh_token',
	'client_id' => '7573fd4a4c421ddd102dac406dc6e0e0e22f683c4a5e81ff0a5caf8b65abed67',
	'client_secret' => 'd9286311451fc6ed71b372a075c58c5058be158f56a77865e43ab3783255424f',
	'refresh_token' => '9697c3d06ccfd1ca302f5a527d345a9f99ea88a2'
]));

$rsp = curl_exec($ch);
curl_close($ch);

var_dump($rsp);

?>

curl --data "action=requesttoken&grant_type=refresh_token&client_id=7573fd4a4c421ddd102dac406dc6e0e0e22f683c4a5e81ff0a5caf8b65abed67&client_secret=d9286311451fc6ed71b372a075c58c5058be158f56a77865e43ab3783255424f&refresh_token=9697c3d06ccfd1ca302f5a527d345a9f99ea88a2" 'https://wbsapi.withings.net/v2/oauth2'

post.description:
This service allows you to retrieve a new authorization code in the event that the refresh token is invalid for a user belonging to your namespace. This service should not be used for standard end-user accounts. To generate a new authorization code for standard end-user accounts, please use the service [OAuth 2.0 - Get your authorization code](#operation/oauth2-authorize).

**This service is limited to partners who are integrating Withings Mobile SDK or Withings Cellular solutions. This service will only work for partners having signed a contract with Withings.**
post.summary: OAuth 2.0 - Retrieve a new authorization code

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Must take the string value ```recoverauthorizationcode```.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: Your ```Client ID```.

parameters.name: nonce
parameters.description: A random token used to prevent replay attacks (Cf. [Signature v2 - Getnonce](#operation/signaturev2-getnonce)).

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description: Hash of params (Cf. [Signature hash protocol](/developer-guide/v3/get-access/sign-your-requests)).

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: User's email address

status.description: Response status. See Status section for details.

code.description: Authorization Code that must be used to retrieve access_token and refresh_token. (Read the "Get access to your user's data" section of your [integration guide](/developer-guide/v3/withings-solutions/integration-guides) to learn more about how to get this parameter.)

curl --data "action=recoverauthorizationcode&client_id=7573fd4a4c421ddd102dac406dc6e0e0e22f683c4a5e81ff0a5caf8b65abed67&signature=58c0c4ad271fb20df9b96c63dc68d6c550c0b7896f743262fc4c5b9261f32ab2&nonce=c455541b8f9111689adb647d32fac07a6ffe462d&email=recoverauthorizationcode@withings.com" 'https://wbsapi.withings.net/v2/oauth2'

post.description:
This service allows you to get a list of all users that have authorized your application to fetch their data.

**This service is limited to partners who are integrating with Withings Pro solutions. This service will only work for partners having signed a contract with Withings.**

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Must take the string value ```listusers```.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: Your ```Client ID```.

parameters.name: nonce
parameters.description: A random token used to prevent replay attacks (Cf. [Signature v2 - Getnonce](#operation/signaturev2-getnonce)).

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description: Hash of params (Cf. [Signature hash protocol](/developer-guide/v3/get-access/sign-your-requests)).

status.description: Response status. See Status section for details.

post.description: This service allows to revoke the access your application have been granted to a user's data. After calling this webservice, your access and refresh tokens for this user will become invalid, and the data update notifications for this user will be automatically unsubscribed.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Must take the string value ```revoke```.

parameters.name: client_id

parameters.name: nonce

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description: Hash of params (Cf. [Signature hash protocol](/developer-guide/v3/get-access/sign-your-requests)).

parameters.name: userid
parameters.description: User's identifier.

status.description: Response status. See Status section for details.

post.description: This webservice gives your clientID access to a demo account containing dummy data
post.summary: OAuth 2.0 - Get access to demo account

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Must take the string value ```getdemoaccess```.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: Your ```Client ID```.

parameters.name: nonce
parameters.description: A random token used to prevent replay attacks (Cf. [Signature v2 - Getnonce](#operation/signaturev2-getnonce)).

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description: Hash of params (Cf. [Signature hash protocol](/developer-guide/v3/get-access/sign-your-requests)).

parameters.name: scope_oauth2
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of permission scopes you want to ask your user for (see the [Index Data API](/developer-guide/v3/data-api/all-available-health-data) section to know which scope you should use).

status.description: Response status. See Status section for details.

expires_in.description: Access token expiry delay in seconds.

x-codeSamples.source:
<?php

$ch = curl_init();

curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, "/v2/oauth2");

curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, TRUE);

curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query([ 
	'action' => 'getdemoaccess',
	'client_id' => '7573fd4a4c421ddd102dac406dc6e0e0e22f683c4a5e81ff0a5caf8b65abed67',
	'signature' => '58c0c4ad271fb20df9b96c63dc68d6c550c0b7896f743262fc4c5b9261f32ab2',
	'nonce' => 'c455541b8f9111689adb647d32fac07a6ffe462d',
	'scope_oauth2' => 'user.activity,user.metrics'
]));

$rsp = curl_exec($ch);
curl_close($ch);

post.description: Provides measures stored at a specific date among the types below. Please refer to the following responses for details.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Service action name. Must take the string value ```getmeas```.

parameters.name: meastype
parameters.description:
Requested measure type :


|Value | Description|
|---|---|
|1 | Weight (kg)|
|4 | Height (meter)|
|5 | Fat Free Mass (kg)|
|6 | Fat Ratio (%)|
|8 | Fat Mass Weight (kg)|
|9 | Diastolic Blood Pressure (mmHg)|
|10 | Systolic Blood Pressure (mmHg)|
|11 | Heart Pulse (bpm) - only for BPM and scale devices|
|12 | Temperature (celsius)|
|54 | SP02 (%)|
|71 | Body Temperature (celsius)|
|73 | Skin Temperature (celsius)|
|76 | Muscle Mass (kg)|
|77 | Hydration (kg)|
|88 | Bone Mass (kg)|
|91 | Pulse Wave Velocity (m/s)|
|123 | VO2 max is a numerical measurement of your body’s ability to consume oxygen (ml/min/kg).|
|135 | QRS interval duration based on ECG signal|
|136 | PR interval duration based on ECG signal|
|137 | QT interval duration based on ECG signal|
|138 | Corrected QT interval duration based on ECG signal|
|139 | Atrial fibrillation result from PPG|
|182 | Blood glucose (mg/dl)|

parameters.name: meastypes
parameters.description:
List of requested measure types (separated by a comma).
Ex: meastypes=1,4,12

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: ```1``` for real measures, ```2``` for user objectives.

parameters.name: startdate
parameters.description: Data start date.

parameters.name: enddate
parameters.description: Data end date.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: When a first call returns ```more:1``` and ```offset:XX```, set value ```XX``` in this parameter to retrieve next available rows.

parameters.name: lastupdate
parameters.description:
Timestamp for requesting data that were updated or created after this date.
Useful for data synchronization between systems.
Use this instead of startdate + enddate.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Used to pass your access token. Must take value: ```Bearer {your access_token}``` Replace {your access_token} with the access_token

status.description: Response status. See Status section for details.

updatetime.description: Server time at which the answer was generated.

measuregrps.description: For every measure/measurement made, a measure group is created. The measure group purpose is to group together measures that have been taken at the same time. For instance, when measuring blood pressure you will have a measure group with a systole measure, a diastole measure, and a heartrate measure. Every time a measure is create/updated/deleted, the corresponding measure group is updated.

more.description: To know if there is more data to fetch or not.

offset.description: Offset to use to retrieve the next data.

post.description:
This service allows to receive notifications from Withings:

- for the Health Data APIs : your application can subscribe to a variety or events, including user data  creation and updates. Notifications will be sent to your servers when the subscribed events occur. ([more information](/developer-guide/v3/data-api/keep-user-data-up-to-date)). Please note that you need to subscribe for each individual user.
- for the Logistics APIs: a notification will be sent when there is an order update ([more information](developer-guide/v3/integration-guide/dropship-only/logistics-api/observe-order-updates))
- for partners integrating Withings Cellular Solutions or Withings Mobile SDK: you can use the ```NO_ACCOUNT_ASSOCIATED``` event to track unassociated devices . Please note you need to subscribe only once per application.

**Note**: depending on your use case, the request parameters may change:

- for the Health Data APIs: use a valid ```access_token``` in the header but don't use ```signature``` and ```nonce``` in the query parameters.
- for the Logistics APIs: the subscription is done automatically an order is placed (please refer to the [dedicated documentation section](developer-guide/v3/integration-guide/dropship-only/logistics-api/observe-order-updates#how-to-receive-order-update-notifications))
- for partners integrating Withings Cellular Solutions or Withings Mobile SDK, to subscribe to the ```NO_ACCOUNT_ASSOCIATED``` event (appli = 53): use ```signature``` and ```nonce``` parameters but don't include an ```access_token``` in the header.

parameters.name: callbackurl
parameters.description: Your ```Callback URL```.

post.description:
Creates a dropshipment order.

If one of the orders has an invalid address, none of the orders will be created.

*This service is part of Withings Pro Solutions. You won't be able to use it if you did not sign a contract with Withings.*
*Do not use this service if you're integrating Withings Cellular Solutions with dropshipment. In that case, please use the createuserorder action*

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Service action name. Must take the string value ```createorder```.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: Id of the client

parameters.name: nonce
parameters.description: A random token used to prevent replay attacks (Cf. [Signature v2 - Getnonce](#operation/signaturev2-getnonce))

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description: Hash of params (Cf. [Signature hash protocol](/developer-guide/v3/get-access/sign-your-requests)).

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Refer to [Order model](#section/Models/Order). The maximum number of orders is 10 per API request.

parameters.name: customerid
parameters.description: Your dropshipment billing ID. If you don't know it, ignore this parameter.

parameters.name: testmode
parameters.description:
If is set, it will create fake orders, and simulate the evolution of the orders status and sending of notifications.
```1```: ```SHIPPED``` sequence
```2```: ```TRASHED``` sequence
```3```: ```FAILED``` sequence
```4```: ```BACKHOLD``` sequence

status.description: Response status. See Status section for details.

orders.description: List of created orders. *(Only if orders were successfully created)*

dropshipmentorderid.description: Unique identifier of the dropshipment order.

invalid_address_customer_ref_ids.description: References of the orders with invalid address. *(Only if at least one order has an invalid address)*

post.description:
Creates a Withings user, then creates a dropshipment order and links the devices shipped to the created user once the device is shipped. If a cellular device is listed in the order field, the service will activate this device's cellular service and invoicing. 

If one of the orders has an invalid address, none of the orders will be created.

Please refer to the [Access and refresh tokens section](/developer-guide/v3/integration-guide/dropship-cellular/get-access/access-and-refresh-tokens) to learn how to use the authorization code you'll get in return of this service in order to fetch user data. The authorization code is only valid for *10 minutes*.

*This service is part of Withings Pro Solutions. You won't be able to use it if you did not sign a contract with Withings.*
*Use this service only if you're integrating Withings Cellular Solutions with dropshipment.*

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Service action name. Must take the string value ```createuserorder```.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: Id of the client

parameters.name: nonce
parameters.description: A random token used to prevent replay attacks (Cf. [Signature v2 - Getnonce](#operation/signaturev2-getnonce))

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description: Hash of params (Cf. [Signature hash protocol](/developer-guide/v3/get-access/sign-your-requests)).

parameters.name: mailingpref
parameters.description: Specifies if customer accepted Withings commercial contacts.

parameters.name: birthdate
parameters.description: Unix timestamp of user's birthdate

parameters.name: measures
parameters.description: User measures (Cf. [Measures](#section/Models/Measures) model).

parameters.name: gender
parameters.description: 0: man, 1: woman

parameters.name: preflang
parameters.description: User language preference. Examples: en_EN / en_US / de_DE / es_ES / fr_FR / it_IT / ja_JA / ko_KR / nl_NL / pt_PT / ru_RU / zh_CN

parameters.name: unit_pref
parameters.description: Unit pref (cf. [Unit preferences](#section/Models/Unit-preferences) model).

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: User's email address

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: User's timezone. Examples: "Europe/Paris" / "America/New_York". A complete list of all possible timezones can be found on the "TZ database name" column of this page : https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones

parameters.name: shortname
parameters.description:
3 characters representing the end user (ex: for a user named Robert, you could set the shortname param to ROB). These characters will be displayed on device screens when used.
Shortname must respect the following regex: /^[a-zA-Z0-9]{3}$/ (either letters or numbers, special characters and spaces are not allowed).

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier used by the partner to identify the end-user. Will be attached to the [data update notifications](/developer-guide/v3/data-api/keep-user-data-up-to-date/)

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Refer to [Order model](#section/Models/Order). The maximum number of orders is 10 per API request.

parameters.name: firstname
parameters.description: User's firstname (if not set, will take the same value as shortname)

parameters.name: lastname
parameters.description: User's lastname (if not set, will take the same value as shortname)

parameters.name: phonenumber
parameters.description: Phone number in E.164 format. End user will receive a verification code on this phone number for 2 factor authentication if they wish to securely access the data of their program in the withings app in the future (recommended)

parameters.name: recovery_code
parameters.description: Recovery code can be used by end user as a 2nd authentication factor in the withings app if they wish to securely access the data of their program in the future.  You will be responsible of securely providing this recovery code to your user if he asks for it.

parameters.name: goals
parameters.description: Goals (cf. [Goals](#section/Models/Goals) model).

parameters.name: testmode
parameters.description:
If is set, it will create fake orders, and simulate the evolution of the orders status and sending of notifications.
```1```: ```SHIPPED``` sequence
```2```: ```TRASHED``` sequence
```3```: ```FAILED``` sequence
```4```: ```BACKHOLD``` sequence

status.description: Response status. See Status section for details.

code.description: Authorization Code that must be used to retrieve access_token and refresh_token. (Read the "Get access to your user's data" section of your [integration guide](/developer-guide/v3/withings-solutions/integration-guides) to learn more about how to get this parameter.)

external_id.description: Unique identifier used by partner to identify the end-user.

orders.description: List of created orders. *(Only if orders were successfully created)*

dropshipmentorderid.description: Unique identifier of the dropshipment order.

invalid_address_customer_ref_ids.description: References of the orders with invalid address. *(Only if at least one order has an invalid address)*

post.description:
A ```nonce``` is a random token that is generated and stored in Withings server with **30 minutes of validity**.

As a partner, you will use this ```nonce``` token in the API services that require a ```signature``` so that Withings can check that the ```nonce``` token is still valid and was never used before. The usage of a ```nonce``` token prevents your service calls from replay attacks.

Because this service is an Device Management service, Withings checks your authorized access using your ```client_id``` and your ```secret``` based ```signature```.

To generate the ```signature``` please follow these steps:

- Sort the following parameters alphabetically:
	- ```action```
	- ```client_id```
	- ```timestamp```
- Generate a string by concatenating values separated by a comma. The string should look like: *value1,value2,value3*.
- Apply a hmac hashing function on the string using the algorithm ```sha256``` and your partner ```client_secret```  (available in your [Withings partner dashboard](https://developer.withings.com/dashboard/)) as a secret key.
- Add the hash string in the parameters under the key ```signature```

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Service action name. Must take the string value ```getnonce```.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: Id of the client

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: unix timestamp

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description: Cf. description above.

status.description: Response status. See Status section for details.

nonce.description: A random timestamp based token to be used once in requiring signature API services to avoid replay attack

curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, "/v2/signature");

curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, TRUE);

curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query([ 
	'action' => 'getnonce',
	'client_id' => 'client_id',
	'timestamp' => 'timestamp',
	'signature' => 'signature'
]));

$rsp = curl_exec($ch);
curl_close($ch);

post.description:
Returns sleep data captured at high frequency, including sleep stages.

**Notes:**

 - If your input ```startdate``` and ```enddate``` are separated by more than 24h, only the first 24h after ```startdate``` will be returned.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Service action name. Must take the string value ```get```.

parameters.name: startdate
parameters.description: Data start date.

parameters.name: enddate
parameters.description: Data end date.

parameters.name: data_fields
parameters.description:
List of requested data fields, separated by a comma.
Available data fields are listed below.
Ex: data_fields=hr,rr,snoring

hr
> Heart Rate.

rr
> Respiration Rate.

snoring
> Total snoring time

sdnn_1
> Heart rate variability - Standard deviation of the NN over 1 minute

rmssd
> Heart rate variability - Root mean square of the successive differences over "a few seconds"

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Used to pass your access token. Must take value: ```Bearer {your access_token}``` Replace {your access_token} with the access_token

status.description: Response status. See Status section for details.

startdate.description: The starting datetime for the sleep state data.

enddate.description: The end datetime for the sleep data. A single call can span up to 7 days maximum. To cover a wider time range, you will need to perform multiple calls.

state.description:
The state of sleeping. Values can be:


| Value | Description|
|---|---|
|0 | Sleep state awake|
|1 | Sleep state light|
|2 | Sleep state deep|
|3 | Sleep state rem|
|4 | Sleep manual|
|5 | Sleep unspecified|

model.description:
Device model. Value can be:


| Value | Description|
|---|---|
|Aura Dock | Sleep Monitor|
|Aura Sensor | Sleep Monitor|
|Aura Sensor V2 | Sleep Monitor|
|Pulse | Activity Tracker|
|Activite | Activity Tracker|
|Activite (Pop, Steel) | Activity Tracker|
|Withings Go | Activity Tracker|
|Activite Steel HR | Activity Tracker|
|Activite Steel HR Sport Edition | Activity Tracker|
|Pulse HR | Activity Tracker|
|Move | Activity Tracker|
|Move ECG | Activity Tracker|
|ScanWatch | Activity Tracker|

|59 | Activite Steel HR Sport Edition|
|58 | Pulse HR|
|90 | Move|
|91 | Move ECG|
|92 | Move ECG|
|93 | ScanWatch|

hr.description: Heart Rate. *(Use 'data_fields' to request this data.)*

$timestamp.description: $timestamp represents the epoch value of the heart rate data, value of this key will be the heart rate data

rr.description: Respiration Rate. *(Use 'data_fields' to request this data.)*

post.description:
Returns sleep activity summaries, which are an aggregation of all the data captured at high frequency during the sleep activity.

Use the [Sleep v2 - Get](#operation/sleepv2-get) service to get the high frequency data used to build these summaries.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Service action name. Must take the string value ```getsummary```.

parameters.name: startdateymd
parameters.description:
DO NOT USE WITH FOLLOWING PARAMS: [lastupdate]
Start date. Required if no lastupdate.

parameters.name: enddateymd
parameters.description:
DO NOT USE WITH FOLLOWING PARAMS: [lastupdate]
End date. Required if startdateymd is provided.

parameters.name: lastupdate
parameters.description:
DO NOT USE WITH FOLLOWING PARAMS: [startdateymd, enddateymd]
Timestamp for requesting data that were updated or created after this date.
Useful for data synchronization between systems.
Use this instead of startdateymd + enddateymd.

parameters.name: data_fields
parameters.description:
List of requested data fields, separated by a comma.
Available data fields are listed below.
Ex: data_fields=apnea_hypopnea_index,asleepduration,breathing_disturbances_intensity

Standard sleep medicine metrics

nb_rem_episodes
> Count of the REM sleep phases.

sleep_efficiency
> Ratio of the total sleep time over the time spent in bed.

sleep_latency
> Time spent in bed before falling asleep.

total_sleep_time
> Total time spent asleep. Sum of light, deep and rem durations.

total_timeinbed
> Total time spent in bed.

wakeup_latency
> Time spent in bed after waking up.

waso
> Time spent awake in bed after falling asleep for the 1st time during the night.


Sleep apnea and breathing disturbances

apnea_hypopnea_index
> Medical grade AHI. Only available for devices purchased in Europe and Australia, with the sleep apnea detection feature activated. Average number of hypopnea and apnea episodes per hour, that occured during sleep time.

breathing_disturbances_intensity
> Wellness metric, available for all Sleep and Sleep Analyzer devices. Intensity of breathing disturbances


Other sleep datapoints and vitals

asleepduration
> Duration of sleep when night comes from external source (light, deep and rem sleep durations are null in this case).

deepsleepduration
> Duration in state deep sleep (in seconds).

durationtosleep
> Time to sleep (in seconds). (deprecated)

durationtowakeup
> Time to wake up (in seconds). (deprecated)

hr_average
> Average heart rate.

hr_max
> Maximal heart rate.

hr_min
> Minimal heart rate.

lightsleepduration
> Duration in state light sleep (in seconds).

night_events
> Events list happened during the night

out_of_bed_count
> Number of times the user got out of bed during the night.

remsleepduration
> Duration in state REM sleep (in seconds).

rr_average
> Average respiration rate.

rr_max
> Maximal respiration rate.

rr_min
> Minimal respiration rate.

sleep_score
> Sleep score

snoring
> Total snoring time

snoringepisodecount
> Numbers of snoring episodes of at least one minute

wakeupcount
> Number of times the user woke up while in bed. Does not include the number of times the user got out of bed.

wakeupduration
> Time spent awake (in seconds).

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Used to pass your access token. Must take value: ```Bearer {your access_token}``` Replace {your access_token} with the access_token

status.description: Response status. See Status section for details.

more.description: To know if there is more data to fetch or not.

offset.description: Offset to use to retrieve the next data.

post.description:
Creates a Withings user, links the devices related to the provided ```mac_addresses``` and activates the cellular devices service and invoicing.

Please refer to the [Access and refresh tokens section](/developer-guide/v3/integration-guide/bulkship-cellular/get-access/access-and-refresh-tokens) to learn how to use the authorization code you'll get in return of this service in order to fetch user data. The authorization code is only valid for *10 minutes*.

**Important**:

- Please note that to activate the Withings HUB cellular service, the ```mac_address``` of the Withings HUB needs to be passed included in the input mac_addresses along with the other Withings devices.
- Please note that the devices need to be authorized to be linked by API by the Partner. Please [contact Withings](mailto:partner-api@withings.com) for more information on device authorization.

*This service is part of Withings Pro Solutions. You won't be able to use it if you did not sign a contract with Withings.*
*Use this service only if you're integrating Withings Cellular Solutions with bulkshipment.*

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Service action name. Must take the string value ```activate```.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: Id of the client

parameters.name: nonce
parameters.description: A random token used to prevent replay attacks (Cf. [Signature v2 - Getnonce](#operation/signaturev2-getnonce))

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description: Hash of params (Cf. [Signature hash protocol](/developer-guide/v3/get-access/sign-your-requests)).

parameters.name: mailingpref
parameters.description: Specifies if customer accepted Withings commercial contacts.

parameters.name: birthdate
parameters.description: Unix timestamp of user's birthdate

parameters.name: measures
parameters.description: User measures (Cf. [Measures](#section/Models/Measures) model).

parameters.name: gender
parameters.description: 0: man, 1: woman

parameters.name: preflang
parameters.description: User language preference. Examples: en_EN / en_US / de_DE / es_ES / fr_FR / it_IT / ja_JA / ko_KR / nl_NL / pt_PT / ru_RU / zh_CN

parameters.name: unit_pref
parameters.description: Unit pref (cf. [Unit preferences](#section/Models/Unit-preferences) model).

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: User's email address

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: User's timezone. Examples: "Europe/Paris" / "America/New_York". A complete list of all possible timezones can be found on the "TZ database name" column of this page : https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones

parameters.name: shortname
parameters.description:
3 characters representing the end user (ex: for a user named Robert, you could set the shortname param to ROB). These characters will be displayed on device screens when used.
Shortname must respect the following regex: /^[a-zA-Z0-9]{3}$/ (either letters or numbers, special characters and spaces are not allowed).

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier used by the partner to identify the end-user. Will be attached to the [data update notifications](/developer-guide/v3/data-api/keep-user-data-up-to-date/)

parameters.name: mac_addresses
parameters.description: List of Withings device MAC addresses that will be linked to the created user. Example: ["00:24:e4:xx:xx:xx","00:24:e4:xx:xx:xx"]

parameters.name: firstname
parameters.description: User's firstname (if not set, will take the same value as shortname)

parameters.name: lastname
parameters.description: User's lastname (if not set, will take the same value as shortname)

parameters.name: phonenumber
parameters.description: Phone number in E.164 format. End user will receive a verification code on this phone number for 2 factor authentication if they wish to securely access the data of their program in the withings app in the future (recommended)

parameters.name: recovery_code
parameters.description: Recovery code can be used by end user as a 2nd authentication factor in the withings app if they wish to securely access the data of their program in the future.  You will be responsible of securely providing this recovery code to your user if he asks for it.

parameters.name: goals
parameters.description: Goals (cf. [Goals](#section/Models/Goals) model).

status.description: Response status. See Status section for details.

code.description: Authorization Code that must be used to retrieve access_token and refresh_token. (Read the "Get access to your user's data" section of your [integration guide](/developer-guide/v3/withings-solutions/integration-guides) to learn more about how to get this parameter.)

external_id.description: Unique identifier used by partner to identify the end-user.

| Value | Description|
|---|---|
|0 | The measuregroup has been captured by a device and is known to belong to this user (and is not ambiguous)|
|1 | The measuregroup has been captured by a device but may belong to other users as well as this one (it is ambiguous)|
|2 | The measuregroup has been entered manually for this particular user|
|4 | The measuregroup has been entered manually during user creation (and may not be accurate)|
|5 | Measure auto, it's only for the Blood Pressure Monitor. This device can make many measures and computed the best value|
|7 | Measure confirmed. You can get this value if the user confirmed a detected activity|
|8 | Same as attrib 0|

wakeup_latency.description: Time spent in bed after waking up. *(Use 'data_fields' to request this data.)*

waso.description: Time spent awake in bed after falling asleep for the 1st time during the night. *(Use 'data_fields' to request this data.)*

attrib.description:
The way the measure was attributed to the user:


| Value | Description|
|---|---|
|0 | The measuregroup has been captured by a device and is known to belong to this user (and is not ambiguous)|
|1 | The measuregroup has been captured by a device but may belong to other users as well as this one (it is ambiguous)|
|2 | The measuregroup has been entered manually for this particular user|
|4 | The measuregroup has been entered manually during user creation (and may not be accurate)|
|5 | Measure auto, it's only for the Blood Pressure Monitor. This device can make many measures and computed the best value|
|7 | Measure confirmed. You can get this value if the user confirmed a detected activity|
|8 | Same as attrib 0|

algo_pause_duration.description:
*Available for all categories except Multi-sport*

Total pause time in seconds detected by Withings device (swim only)

calories.description:
*Available for all categories except Multi-sport*

Active calories burned (in Kcal). *(Use 'data_fields' to request this data.)*

distance.description:
*Available for all categories except Swimming, Multi-sport*

Distance travelled (in meters). *(Use 'data_fields' to request this data.)*

elevation.description:
*Available for all categories except Swimming, Multi-sport*

Number of floors climbed. *(Use 'data_fields' to request this data.)*

hr_average.description:
*Available for all categories except Multi-sport*

Average heart rate. *(Use 'data_fields' to request this data.)*

hr_max.description:
*Available for all categories except Multi-sport*

Maximal heart rate. *(Use 'data_fields' to request this data.)*

hr_min.description:
*Available for all categories except Multi-sport*

Minimal heart rate. *(Use 'data_fields' to request this data.)*

hr_zone_0.description:
*Available for all categories except Multi-sport*

Duration in seconds when heart rate was in a light zone (cf. Glossary). *(Use 'data_fields' to request this data.)*

hr_zone_1.description:
*Available for all categories except Multi-sport*

Duration in seconds when heart rate was in a moderate zone (cf. Glossary). *(Use 'data_fields' to request this data.)*

hr_zone_2.description:
*Available for all categories except Multi-sport*

Duration in seconds when heart rate was in an intense zone (cf. Glossary). *(Use 'data_fields' to request this data.)*

hr_zone_3.description:
*Available for all categories except Multi-sport*

Duration in seconds when heart rate was in maximal zone (cf. Glossary). *(Use 'data_fields' to request this data.)*

intensity.description:
*Available for all categories except Multi-sport*

Intensity of the workout, from 0 to 100, as inputed by the user. If the user didn't manually give the intensity of his workout, the value will be 0.

manual_calories.description:
*Available for all categories except Multi-sport*

Active calories burned manually entered by user (in Kcal). *(Use 'data_fields' to request this data.)*

manual_distance.description:
*Available for all categories except Multi-sport*

Distance travelled manually entered by user (in meters). *(Use 'data_fields' to request this data.)*

pause_duration.description:
*Available for all categories except Multi-sport*

Total pause time in second filled by user

pool_laps.description:
*Available only for Swimming*

Number of pool laps. *(Use 'data_fields' to request this data.)*

pool_length.description:
*Available only for Swimming*

Length of the pool. *(Use 'data_fields' to request this data.)*

spo2_average.description:
*Available for all categories except Multi-sport*

Average percent of SpO2 percent value during a workout

steps.description:
*Available for all categories except Swimming, Multi-sport*

Number of steps. *(Use 'data_fields' to request this data.)*

strokes.description:
*Available only for Swimming*

Number of strokes. *(Use 'data_fields' to request this data.)*
